Course_Name: Methods of Impact Assessment - Planning, Program and Policy Levels (SoSe24)

Messages.Author: Gesa Geiﬂler
Messages.Content: Hello together, as announced, the course evaluation form is available here: https://befragung.tu-berlin.de/evasys/online.php?p=S821E You will also have time next Monday to fill in the form during the class but feel free to compete it also beforehand. With best regards, Gesa

Messages.Author: Jakob Benjamin Schlicht
Messages.Content: Hi Gesa, I think it would be helpful if we would get more info on what exactly needs to be put on there.  You mentionend in the intro you would send us more info via email at some point.  Thank you in advance, Jakob

Messages.Author: Gesa Geiﬂler
Messages.Content: Hi Jakob and all others,  I'm sorry for getting back to you so late, this week has been unexpectedly busy for various reasons. As I think it might be good to clarify your questions on this before you submit your draft concept I suggest to postpone the deadline to Tuesday afternoon. Moreover, I will join the course next Monday to be able to clarify questions directly.  Overall the concept shall be the plan for your group of how you want to structure the session/workshop you have chosen and some first thoughts also on the input presentation that you plan to give. So, see it as a first step in getting started to think about it in your group and to start making a plan/a concept. On that basis I will be able to provide feedback and support your further work on it.  I hope this helps, even it is late now. Best regards, Gesa

Messages.Author: Gesa Geiﬂler
Messages.Content: Hi together, thanks for participating in the poll on ISIS on the workshop topics. Please find the results and workshops groups now on the ISIS page. Please start preparing your workshop and let me know if there should be any questions or uncertainties. With best regards, Gesa

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Selection of Workshop Topics until Fri, 24/5/2024

Messages.Author: Gesa Geiﬂler
Messages.Content: Hello together, as we have almost reached the half of the semester, I would like you to choose the topic for the workshop you will be organising in the second half of the Methods course. As introduced in the first class, we will have 4 student organized workshop sessions for the course Methods of IA - plan, program, policy-level. You find the "fair allocation" tool on ISIS and also the general task for the workshop organization. Please choose by Friday, 24th noon, thus I will inform you about the allocation Friday in the afternoon. For the workshop and your input please come up with a first draft concept by Mai 31st (to be uploaded on ISIS), thus I can provide feedback in due time. I will join the class on June 3rd for any open questions and final remarks. Let me know if there is anything unclear. Best regards and looking forward to working with you in the course, Gesa

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Information on researcher joining our course

Messages.Author: Gesa Geiﬂler
Messages.Content: Hello together, I forgot to mention something earlier today. I would like to inform you that this semester there will be a researcher - Vera Spangler - following our Methods of IA course for her PhD work. I attach an information letter (which is also uploaded on ISIS) and more info about Vera Spangler below. She will introduce herself and her resaerch in person in one of the coming classes. We have decided amongst the Master EP staff and faculty that we find her research very relevant and that we want to support her by allowing her to join our classes and observe them. She will keep this anonymous in her Phd, so it will not be diclosed, which program she participated in for her research and of course no individual or personal information will be disclosed. Please have a look at the information sheet which details this and provides information also about data protection etc. I hope you will be ok having her in our class. With best regards, Gesa ------ Vera Spangler is a PhD student in the Department of Sociology at the University of Surrey, UK. Her project is a cross-national study between the UK, Denmark, and Germany and is anchored in ethnographic fieldwork and different qualitative methods. Vera will spend time in Berlin following your programme as part of her study between April - July. The main focus of her project is on international students studying a masterís degree in a place other than their home country. Vera wishes to explore the production of knowledge in different higher education settings, including everyday practices and interactions in classrooms, on campus but also other social sites. She wishes to observe what happens in an ëinternational classroomí when lecturers and students from places meet and learn together. Here, Vera is interested to learn about what knowledges international students bring with them, what knowledges they may receive, and how (new) knowledge is produced through encounters between students and lecturers. Vera will introduce herself when she arrives in April but if you're interested to find out more about her project already, you can find some more details in the information sheets attached. You are also welcome to write her an email (v.spangler@surrey.ac.uk) if you have any questions.

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Methods of IA 2024: Welcome & tentative list of participants

Messages.Author: Juliane Biehl
Messages.Content: Welcome to Methods of IA 2024, Our first meeting is on Monday, 15 April 2024, from 10:15 a.m. to noon in FH 315 (Fraunhoferstr. 33-36 at campus Charlottenburg). Please ensure to be there on time. I am attaching the tentative list of participants; please check it thoroughly. If you are listed on the document and want to participate in the class: Attend the first lecture following Monday, 15 April 2024, at 10 a.m. (c.t.), Room FH 315 (Fraunhofer building) and register for the course on MTS by 19 April 2024. Important: If you are sick or cannot attend the first meeting, please inform your advisors by emailing juliane.biehl@tu-berlin.de (including your name and matriculation N∞ and expressing your interest in participating and enrolling in the class). If you are not listed on this document but wish to participate in this year's Methods of IA class: Please notify juliane.biehl@tu-berlin.de by Thursday, 11 April 2024. Please provide all relevant information (full name, study course, matriculation number, current semester, core elective/free elective class, etc.). AND attend the first meeting. The module Methods of IA consists of two seminars/integrated lectures. Please make sure that you are enrolled in both Moodle/ISIS courses: Project-level Planning-level We look forward to welcoming you and getting to know you on Monday. Feel free to bring your laptop, iPad/tablet or smartphone for some interactive elements (not required, though). Later this week, I will send a tentative agenda for the following Monday. Kind regards Juliane Biehl & Gesa Geiﬂler
